1 (function($NS){
  2     var utils = $NS.utils;
  3     
  4     /**
  5      * Function transforms an object into 
  6      * iterable array
  7      * 
  8      * @function
  9      * @private
 10      * @param {Object} obj
 11      * 
 12      * @returns {Array}
 13      */
 14 	function objectToIterable(obj){
 15 		var key,
 16 			iterable = [];
 17 			
 18 		for(key in obj){
 19 			if(obj.hasOwnProperty(key)){
 20 				iterable.push(obj[key]);
 21 			}
 22 		}
 23 		
 24 		return iterable;
 25 	}
 26 	
 27     /**
 28      * Iterator. 
 29      * Creates an instance of Iterator object which can be used 
 30      * to iterate over the objects, arrays, and strings.
 31      * @class
 32      * @name py.Iterator
 33      * @implements py.IIterable
 34      * @constructor
 35      * @param {Array | String | Object} iterableObject
 36      */
 37 	$NS.Class('Iterator', { Implements: $NS.IIterable,
 38 		
 39 		construct: function(iterableObject){
 40 			
 41 			if(iterableObject instanceof Array){
 42 				this.__iterable = iterableObject;
 43 			}else if(iterableObject && utils.isObject(iterableObject)){
 44 				this.__iterable = objectToIterable(iterableObject);
 45 			}else if(iterableObject && utils.isString(iterableObject)){
 46 				this.__iterable = iterableObject.split('');
 47 			}else{
 48 				throw 'non iterable';
 49 			}
 50 			
 51 			this.__currentItem = null;
 52 			this.__index = null;
 53 			this.first();
 54 		},
 55 		
 56 		/**
 57 		 * Function returns first element on iterable object
 58 		 * and reset the iterator pointer to the first element
 59 		 * @function
 60 		 * @name py.Iterator#first
 61 		 * @returns {Object} first item on the iterable list
 62 		 */
 63 		first: function(){
 64 			this.__index = 0;
 65 			return this.currentItem();
 66 		},
 67 		
 68 		/**
 69 		 * Function moves iterator pointer to point the next element
 70 		 * and returns that element. It will return undefined value
 71 		 * if iteration has ended
 72 		 * @function
 73 		 * @name py.Iterator#next
 74 		 * @returns {Object} next item on iterable list
 75 		 */
 76 		next: function(){
 77 			var self = this;
 78 			if(!self.isDone()){
 79 				self.__index++;
 80 				return self.currentItem();
 81 			}
 82 		},
 83 		
 84 		/**
 85 		 * Function returns current item iterator
 86 		 * pointer is poiniting to
 87 		 * @function
 88 		 * @name py.Iterator#currentItem
 89 		 * @returns {Object} current item on iterable list
 90 		 */
 91 		currentItem: function(){
 92 			return this.__iterable[this.__index];
 93 		},
 94 		
 95 		/**
 96 		 * Function returns true if the iteration has 
 97 		 * reached the limit
 98 		 * @function
 99 		 * @name py.Iterator#isDone
100 		 * @returns {Boolean} 
101 		 */
102 		isDone: function(){
103 			return this.__index === this.__iterable.length;
104 		},
105 
106         /**
107          * Function will execute provided function handler
108          * on every element in the iterable object
109          * @function
110          * @name py.Iterator#each
111          * @param {Object} fn fuction which will be executed on each element
112          * @returns {Array} array of results 
113          */
114 		each: function(fn){
115 			var self = this,
116 				iterable = self.__iterable,
117 				results = [],
118 				i,
119 				l = iterable.length;
120 			if(utils.isFunction(fn)){
121 				for(i=0; i<l; i++){
122 					self.__index = i;
123 					results.push(fn(iterable[i], i, iterable));
124 				}
125 			}
126 			
127 			return results;
128 		}
129 		
130 	}, $NS);
131 	
132 }(py));
133
